pageContent: In Australia prostate cancer is the most commonly diagnosed cancer in men, with around 20,000 diagnosed each year (AIHW 2013, 2014). The many who survive it often battle with significant side-effects from treatment such as incontinence, loss of sexual function, fatigue and psychology issues.

metaData.source:
Erectile function outcome reporting after clinically localized prostate cancer treatment
https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/17570435/
